share.share_text:
Dear Black Bean community,

It is with mixed emotions that we announce the closing of the current Black Bean Cafe location at the end of January 2025. While this closure was not part of our original plans, it comes as a result of our landlords not renewing our lease due to âa family decision.â

After the initial disappointment, we began to see this as an exciting opportunity. We know that in many ways, we have outgrown our cozy little space. With that realization, we are thrilled to share our next chapter with you: coming soon... Mollyâs Reach by Black Bean Cafe!

We are incredibly grateful to everyone who has supported us over the years and made the Black Bean Cafe feel like home. We canât wait to welcome you back and see all your familiar faces at Mollyâs Reach!

share.share_text:
Wende Cragg (@wendecragg12) has been a pillar of the cycling community since she began documenting road, cyclocross, and the early days of mountain biking in Marin County, California, and throughout the United States over 50 years ago. 

We are delighted to launch the trailer for our first feature-length documentary film, Camera Corner: Wende Cragg Documents the Birth of Mountain Biking. It profiles Wendeâs work and its lasting impact on the cycling industry.

Weâre also unveiling a book and merch pre-order, as well as the beginning of a growing list of film screenings. These kick off with the world premiere at the @marinmuseumofbicycling on August 16th & 17th and another at @made.bike movie night on August 23rd. 

Thereâs exclusive early viewing access, pre-orders for an epic photobook featuring Wendeâs work, and an associated throwback merchandise run.

Head over to theradavis.com for all the details!

ââ

Director @jweinberg 
Producers @johnprolly @caricarmean @jweinberg 
Director of Photography @justinbalog
Editor @_chris.motta 
VFX/Animations @the.scorps
